title.native: Re:ゼロから始める異世界生活 2nd Season
title.romaji: Re:Zero kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu 2nd Season
title.english: Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World- Season 2

description:
Even after dying countless times, Subaru finally ended the threat of the White Whale and defeated the Witch Cult's Sin Archbishop representing sloth, Petelgeuse Romaneeconti. But only shortly after overcoming a tragic ending and reuniting with his beloved Emilia, Subaru learns that Rem has been erased from this world, having fallen victim to the White Whale's Fog of Elimination in the midst of Subaru's death loop. With the White Whale now gone, Subaru and Emilia are forced to confront a reality they never dreamed would happen.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: Re:从零开始的异世界生活第二季（上半）
Re:从零开始的异世界生活 2 上半
Re:Zero รีเซทชีวิต ฝ่าวิกฤตต่างโลก ภาค 2
Re:Zero — жизнь с нуля в другом мире. Второй сезон

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Time Loop
tags.description: A character is stuck in a repetitive cycle that they are attempting to break out of. This is distinct from a manipulating time of their own choice.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

node.description:
[Website](http://konomi-suzuki.net/) | [Old Blog](http://ameblo.jp/galapa-konomi) | [New Blog](http://ameblo.jp/konomi-suzuki/)

Konomi Suzuki is a Japanese singer from Osaka Prefecture who is signed to Amuleto. After winning the Animax All-Japan Anisong Grand Prix in 2011, she made her debut in 2012 with the release of her first single "Choir Jail", which peaked at 34 on the Oricon charts; the title track of which was used as the opening theme to the anime television series Dusk Maiden of Amnesia. She released her first album 17, in 2014, two albums in 2015, and a further album Lead, in 2016.

Suzuki cites the character Sheryl Nome from Macross Frontier as her inspiration for making music for anime. Her music has been featured in anime series such as The Pet Girl of Sakurasou, No Matter How I Look at It, It's You Guys' Fault I'm Not Popular!, No Game No Life, and Re:Zero − Starting Life in Another World. She has also performed in events in Japan such as Animelo Summer Live and Animax Musix, and at international events in China, Germany, the United States, and Southeast Asia. In 2018, Suzuki made her voice acting debut, playing the role of Rin in the anime television series Lost Song.

Formerly affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/) and [Ordet](https://anilist.co/studio/334/). He was one of the people to follow [Yutaka Yamamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/101655/) to Ordet after its establishment. After leaving Kyoto Animation he primarily used the pen name Gorou Sessha and became well known for his work in the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) franchise. His directorial debut was [Naruto: Rock Lee & His Ninja Pals](https://anilist.co/anime/12979/) which he directed from episode 27 onwards under the supervision of [Masahiko Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/102608/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/saifu1low)

Masahiro Yokotani does series composition and scriptwriting.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She joined [Magic Bus](https://anilist.co/studio/207/) after having graduated from from Yoyogi Animation Academy. She holds a pencil and colored pencil in the same hand simultaneously which allows her to draw shading immediately after drawing the linework.

Her real name is Kumiko Sakai, and she is occasionally mistaken for a man due to her pseudonym, which she has been credited with since 2000. She is also friends with [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/), and they often participate in the same productions. They're both big idol fans and their friendship sparked due to a conversation about Morning Musume, a girl group.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She joined [Magic Bus](https://anilist.co/studio/207/) after having graduated from from Yoyogi Animation Academy. She holds a pencil and colored pencil in the same hand simultaneously which allows her to draw shading immediately after drawing the linework.

Her real name is Kumiko Sakai, and she is occasionally mistaken for a man due to her pseudonym, which she has been credited with since 2000. She is also friends with [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/), and they often participate in the same productions. They're both big idol fans and their friendship sparked due to a conversation about Morning Musume, a girl group.

__Hometown:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Omiya Koryo High School and SHOBI College of Music

[Profile (One Music)](https://one-music.jp/suehiro/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenichiro_s) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kenichiro.suehiro)

A Japanese pianist, composer, and arranger.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大田和寛)

Freelancer with former ties with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/) and [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).

[Blog](http://halfawake.blog.shinobi.jp/%E8%87%AA%E5%B7%B1%E7%B4%B9%E4%BB%8B/%E7%81%AF%E5%A4%A2) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LlittleTomBoy) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/halfawakerobotman/)

Tom is a Japanese composite artist and designer affiliated with company [Digital Noise](https://d-noise.co.jp/).
